definition: to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format
appearance/portrait/picture/government minister/(physics) phase/(literary) to appraise (esp. by scrutinizing physical features)/to read sb's fortune (by physiognomy, palmistry etc)
each other/one another/mutually/fret on the neck of a pipa 琵琶[pi2 pa5] (a fret on the soundboard is called a 品[pin3])
to see/to meet/to appear (to be sth)/to interview

sentences.english: During the talk among the comrades, nothing should be concealed.
sentences.chinese: 同志間的交談應該是開誠相見。

sentences.english: You don't mind my being frank, do you?
sentences.chinese: 我和你開誠相見，你不在意吧？

sentences.english: And do, please, be frank with us.
sentences.chinese: 請務必和我們開誠相見。
